pullRequest.title: Resolve SSO roles by pattern
pullRequest.bodyText:
This changes a SamlServiceProvider to have a function that maps
from an "action-name" to set of role-names instead of a Map that does
so.
The on-disk representation of this mapping is a set of Java Regexp
Patterns, for which the first matching group is the role name.
For example "sso:(\w+)" would map any action that started with "sso:"
to the corresponding role name (e.g. "sso:superuser" -> "superuser").

commit.message:
Resolve SSO roles by pattern

This changes a SamlServiceProvider to have a function that maps
from an "action-name" to set of role-names instead of a Map that does
so.

The on-disk representation of this mapping is a set of Java Regexp
Patterns, for which the first matching group is the role name.

For example "sso:(\w+)" would map any action that started with "sso:"
to the corresponding role name (e.g. "sso:superuser" -> "superuser").
Update IdentityProviderAuthenticationIT to use role prefix
Merge branch 'idp/role-prefix' of github.com:tvernum/elasticsearch into idp/role-prefix

nodes.bodyText:
Can you explain why we preload this cache? I think it's because

we know we should be getting many requests for the default application but
we don't want to statically resolve the actions in here as these are configurable ( even if they probably won't change often ) and
we don't want to be making GetPrivilege related searches to the security index too often.

Would this behavior change when we add a cache for Application Privileges and if so, should we add a TODO or note here ?
